==Dialogue==
===Dialogue Set #1===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Araprabhu:''' Festival Utsava is coming soon, but the training cannot stop. Should work even harder...
:{{DIcon}} Hello.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Hello, Nara friend.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Everyone is happy to hear that you are preparing for Festival Utsava with Arama.
:{{DIcon}} About the training...
::'''Araprabhu:''' The happier Aranara are, the less they notice the black mud and rainwater.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Before Festival Utsava starts, Araprabhu must train harder to protect Vanarana.
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Careful, don't get lost. Vana is very dangerous now.
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #2===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Araprabhu:''' After Arama started training, Arama obtained Ararakalari none had ever seen. I must work hard too, to come close to Aradasha.
:{{DIcon}} About Aradasha...
::'''Araprabhu:''' Araprabhu wants to be a legend like Aradasha.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Standing up against the iron constructs and defending Vanarana.
::'''Araprabhu:''' To become like Aradasha and be able to crush the Big Iron Chunks in the blink of an eye.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Araprabhu will keep practicing Ararakalari.
:{{DIcon}} About the training...
::'''Araprabhu:''' Araprabhu's training goal is to defeat Vanagni.
::'''Araprabhu:''' The thought of the flames Vanagni spits gives Araprabhu shivers... But there must be a way...
:{{DIcon}} Goodbye.
::'''Araprabhu:''' Goodbye, Golden Nara. The forest will guide you.
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #3===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Araprabhu:''' Festival Utsava is a happy day! So Araprabhu will...
:'''Araprabhu:''' Practice even harder!
{{Dialogue End}}

===Dialogue Set #4===
{{Dialogue Start}}
:'''Araprabhu:''' Training on Ararakalari... Mustn't slack off!
:'''Araprabhu:''' A Nara. A lost Nara?
{{Dialogue End}}
==Trivia==
===Etymology===
*Araprabhu is derived from {{w|Prabhu}}, means master or prince in Sanskrit and many of the Indian languages. It is a name sometimes applied to God.
